meanings.definition: Relating to or situated at the center.
meanings.sent1: The centrical point of the maze was where all paths met.
meanings.sent2: The town hall is a centrical location for community events.
meanings.sent3: The cake's centrical decoration was a tiny dancing bear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the centrical charm of the party.
meanings.sent5: The centrical star in the sky shone the brightest.

meanings.sent1: The centrical role of the captain was to lead the team.
meanings.sent2: Education plays a centrical role in shaping young minds.
meanings.sent3: The centrical joke in the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her centrical idea sparked a new wave of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The centrical character in the story stole the show.
